Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TtAP-3 (ToAP-4; ToAP4, natural AMPs; XXA, UCLL1c, scorpions, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: Venom,Tityus obscurus, Also: the Trinidad Thick-Tailed Scorpion,Tityus trinitatis

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: The same sequence was initially discovered in Tityus obscurus. Found in multiple speciesSequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (94.12%) toscorpine 	ImcroporinI=L: 18%; G: 12%. GRAVY: 1.64; Mol W: 1762.166; Mol formula:C86H140N18O21; Mol Ex coeff: 0.Activity: active against P.aeruginosa DSM 50071 (MIC >400 ug/ml), E.coli DSM 787 (MIC 200 ug/ml), K.pneumoniae ATCC BAA 1705 (MIC >400 ug/ml), A. baumannii DSM 30008 (MIC 100 ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC 43300 (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. epidermidis DSM 28319 (MIC 100 ug/ml), E. faecalis MF 06036 (MIC 100 ug/ml), E. faecium NCTC 12201 (MIC 50 ug/ml), and C. difficile DSM 27147 or ATCC BAA 1382 (MIC 50 ug/ml) (Mechkarska  et al., 2023).Toxicity: murine RBC: HC50 95 ug/ml, moderate hemolytic.
Literature Information.Author: Guilhelmelli F, Vilela N, Smidt KS, de Oliveira MA, da Cunha Morales √Ålvares A, Rigonatto MC, da Silva Costa PH, Tavares AH, de Freitas SM, Nicola AM, Franco OL, Derengowski LD, Schwartz EF, Mortari MR, Bocca AL, Albuquerque P, Silva-Pereira I.2016
Literature Information.Title: Activity of Scorpion Venom-Derived Antifungal Peptides against Planktonic Cells of Candida spp. and Cryptococcus neoformans and Candida albicans Biofilms.
